DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent  Disease Therapeutic Procedure Administered Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator that asks if the patients disease is resistant to therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have refractory/
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have refractory/relapsed disease to at least one line of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received less than 3 lines of prior therapy and has relapsed less than a year from their last platinum regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has relapsed MDS, does patient have disease recurrence  after CR, PR or hematologic improvement with bone marrow blasts greater than or equal to 5% who relapse after Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant, or after four cycles of any hypomethylating agent-based therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have relapsed or refractory disease after at least 1 prior regimen, defined using the 2014 Lugano classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have disease that is recurrent or refractory to standard therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the dose escalation cohort, does patient have multiple myeloma that has relapsed or is refractory to at least one prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have relapsed (greater than or equal to 5% bone marrow blasts by morphology or reappearance of minimal residual disease by flow cytometry, reappearance of peripheral blood blasts, or development of extramedullary leukemia after one or two prior lines of therapy) or refractory (no CR or CR1 after two courses of induction) AML?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has evidence of relapsed MDS, does patient have disease recurrence after CR, PR or hematologic improvement with bone marrow blasts greater than or equal to 5% who relapse after Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant, or after four cycles of any hypomethylating agent-based therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is disease refractory to at least one attempt at remission induction (including, but not limited to, 7+3, Ida-FLAG and NOVE-HiDAC) OR AML relapse following at least one induction regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient in first relapse after primary chemotherapy-refractory disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has primary or recurrent disease that is targeted-treatment na√Øve or will be treated with a targeted therapy listed in Table 1, is the treatment different from any previously-received targeted therapy or combination therapy as standard of care?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have recurrent disease within a previously irradiated area (radiotherapy to dose greater than or equal to 40 Gy, i.e., in-field recurrence)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a solid tumor or hematologic malignancy, is it now recurrent, newly metastasized, or progressing while on treatment as indicated by: radiographic evidence of tumor growth and/or new metastases, OR documentation by the treating physician of clinical disease progression OR CBC w/differential and/or flow cytometry for hematologic malignancies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there evidence of relapsed, refractory, or progressive disease following at least one line of treatment as defined by NCCN guidelines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have refractory AML as measured by no CR (complete remission) or CRi (CR with incomplete count recovery) after one or more cycles of induction therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have relapsed/refractory DLBCL after 1 or more prior lines of therapy, except for patients receiving CAR T in second line that have a D score of 3 at D+ 30 through D+ 90?
